content.description: For years people have climbed the bottom half of this line in "Survival Mode" when climbing No Name Game. Not anymore. It's now a fully equipped line and more. Enjoy & Cheers!
content.protection: 5 bolts to the ledge then continue up the arete/face 4 bolts to Lower Offs. Same finish and anchor as No Name Game.
content.location: Left most route on Shooting Gallery Wall

content.description: The bottom comes out a small roof to difficult climbing with the crux just above the second bolt. Above the small ledge are easy, juggy moves then a scramble to the anchors.The bolting on this route has been modernized.
content.location: The 3rd from the Left route on the Shooting Gallery Face.

content.description: Name Game is the second line of bolts on the left side of the Shooting Gallery. Thin, vertical facing climbing on small crimps past 4 bolts to a big ledge. Then 4 more bolts lead you up easier but exposed climbing on the upper tier, to chain anchors.As noted in the comments, there is decking potential on the upper section -- there are some delicate moves, and you are largely out of sight of your belayer.
Begin with Reef Lightly and then finish up The Chiller.
Climb face and arete down and over from The Viper.  Right side of the Big Square Slab.  Little funky clipping some bolts.
content.protection: 7 bolts to 3 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: The Shooting Gallery is to the West of the big roof with the Pulse.  Big square slab.

content.description: Come out a small roof at the base onto crimps with more difficult, reachy moves up steep rock. Well protected with 7 bolts plus chains.
content.location: The middle route on the Shooting Gallery face.

content.description: Sunny until early afternoon.  The 10's on this wall are high quality and generally less crowded than Mr. Slate.
